Interface Aggregate

public interface Aggregate
An object with dependencies.

By default, Aggregates have no dependencies.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
  • dependencies()

  • Field Details

    • EMPTY_ASSIGNMENTS

      static final SequencedSet<Assignment<?>> EMPTY_ASSIGNMENTS
      An immutable, empty SequencedSet of Assignments.

  • Method Details

    • dependencies

      default SequencedSet<AttributedElement> dependencies()
      Returns an immutable SequencedSet of AttributedElement instances.
      Returns:
      an immutable SequencedSet of AttributedElement instances; never null
      See Also:
      • AttributedElement

    • assign

      default SequencedSet<? extends Assignment<?>> assign(Function<? super AttributedType, ?> r)
      A convenience method that assigns a contextual reference to each of this Aggregate's AttributedElement instances and returns the resulting SequencedSet of Assignments.

      Typically there is no need to override this method.

      Parameters:
      r - a Function that retrieves a contextual reference suitable for an AttributedType; if dependencies() returns a non-empty SequencedSet then this argument must not be null
      Returns:
      an immutable SequencedSet of Assignment instances; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if r is null
